bioghist.p: Thomas F. Powell, former Dean of Arts and Sciences at the State University of New York at Oswego, donated this collection of middle and late 19th century material to preserve its contents. Dr. Powell is a distinguished author in the field of American history having written dozens of articles and books upon the subject. His most recognized works are “Josiah Royce”, “Humanities and the Social Studies” and “Penet’s Square”.

scopecontent.p: Letter from S.C. Osgood to Sophia M. Osgood, Hamilton, NY. September 27, 1838. Original

Correspondence from Bennie F. Murfitt to his family. June 28, 1863 to April 8, 1865. 9 letters. Photocopies.
Murfitt was a sargeant in Company G, 150th New York Volunteer Regiment. Letters from Maryland, Virginia, Washington D.C., Tennessee, Georgia and North Carolina.

Civil War material. Discharge papers from Private George H. Stephens, Company B, 4th Battery, New York Volunteers Artillary. December 15, 1862.
Sworn statement of J.N. Rega, M.D. of Belleville, Jefferson County, about unfitness for duty of A.R. Wardwell, Company B, 92nd New York Regiment. November 21, 1864. Furlough paper.

Material about roll road from Watertown to Watertown Centre. April 16, 1869 to August 3, 1869. Four items, original.
Three notices from L.T. Sawyer, Plank Road Inspector that due to disrepair of the turnpike no tolls can be charged and one statement by Joseph Newton, Inspector of Plank and Turnpike Roads for Jefferson County, that the Watertown Central Plank Road is in good repair.

Miscellaneous legal and business papers.
Copy of the will of Paul Anthony of LeRoy, Jefferson County. August 23, 1847.
Indenture between Champlin Harrison, Frances S. Harrison and Anna M. Harrison and Clarissa Wardwell. February 1, 1864. Land deed.
Deed of patent rights to George H. Stephens. November 19, 1869.
Notice of Warrant in Bankruptcy issued for Norris Winslow to Hannibal Smith. November 1878.
Blank Certificate of Authority appointing agent of Watertown Fire Insurance Co. 1870's. Signed by Secretary and General Agent
Watertown File Insurance Company policy no. 5974, for W.S. Gibson, Elmira, NY. March 9, 1878.
Form letter from the Office of the New York State Dairy Commissioner. August 11, 1887.

Miscellaneous business correspondence.
Cover letter for sending legal documents from the Office of the Secretary of State of the State of New York to Hannibal Smith. February 28, 1880.
Letter from the Office of the General Superintendent of the Utica and Black River Railroad Company to the Watertown Agent, J.W. Moake. December 10, 1884.

Bill of Fare, Woodruff House, Watertown, NY. n.d.
Receipts: for payment of Watertown city tax by W.J. Shepard. October 18, 1879.
Check: from Agricultural Insurance Company to Emanuel Hadcock. January 20, 1875.
Bills of laden: Freight shipped by J. Johnson on the Rome, Watertown and Ogdensburg Railroad Company. September 7, 1874 and December 11, 1874.
